bcl:subsection.bcl:text:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing eligibility requirements;
prescribing amounts of financial assistance;
prescribing the manner in which financial assistance is provided;
respecting applications for financial assistance, including prescribing information required to be included in applications;
authorizing the minister responsible for the administration of this section to extend a deadline that may be prescribed under paragraph (a) or (d) of this subsection;
authorizing the indirect collection of personal information necessary to determine a child's eligibility for financial assistance;

prescribing conditions under which financial assistance is provided, or authorizing the minister responsible for the administration of this section to establish conditions under which financial assistance is provided;

respecting repayments to the government of financial assistance under the British Columbia Training and Education Savings Program, including requiring that repayments be made and prescribing circumstances in which repayments must be made;
providing that payments from the special account are not subject to any process of garnishment, attachment, execution or seizure by a creditor.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations for the purposes of subsection (6) (a), including, without limitation, regulations doing one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing classes of persons;

bcl:link.in:doc: Child, Family and Community Service Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person has no right of action and must not commence or maintain proceedings, as a result of amendments made by B.C. Reg. 132/2013 to the eligibility requirements for financial assistance from the British Columbia Training and Education Savings Program, in respect of any representations that were made or may have been made or any trusts that were created or may have been created in respect of the Children's Education Fund,

bcl:text.#text: Treasury Board may direct that an amount in respect of amounts received by the government under the  be transferred to the special account.

Despite sections 21 (3) and 45 (1) of the  but subject to subsection (4.1) of this section and the prior approval of Treasury Board, the Minister of Finance may pay money out of the special account for the following purposes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: acquiring, constructing, maintaining or renovating housing or shelter;
acquiring or improving land used for or intended to be used for housing or shelter;
supporting the acquisition, construction, maintenance, renovation or retention of housing or shelter or the acquisition or improvement of land intended to be used for housing or shelter;
supporting housing, rental or shelter programs;

making loans to persons in relation to the acquisition, construction, maintenance, renovation or retention of housing or shelter or the acquisition or improvement of land intended to be used for housing or shelter;
administering, continuing, exchanging and disposing of loans made under paragraph (e);
paying amounts required to be paid by the government in relation to guarantees given under subsection (5) of this section;
paying expenses related to the administration or disposal of housing, shelter or land acquired with money paid out of the special account;
paying the expenses of administering the special account or any other expenses related to administering other activities undertaken under this subsection.

bcl:text.#text: An amount received by the government under the  in respect of a regional district that includes a specified area may only be paid out of the special account under subsection (4) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purpose for which the amount is to be paid relates to a housing, shelter or rental initiative in or for a specified area that is part of the regional district, and

bcl:text.#text: the total of all amounts paid in accordance with this subsection in respect of all specified areas that are part of the regional district does not exceed the total of all amounts received by the government under the  in respect of that regional district.

Despite section 72 (3) of the , the Minister of Finance may, on behalf of the government, guarantee the repayment of all or part of a loan by a person if the loan is in relation to the acquisition, construction, maintenance, renovation or retention of housing or shelter or the acquisition or improvement of land intended to be used for housing or shelter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A guarantee may only be given under subsection (5) if prior approval of Treasury Board has been obtained.
